channel.title: Virus'd! :O
channel.description:
Yes, I somehow got a virus that i can't delete, tryed avg, ad-aware, spyware. Nothing will get rid of it :|
So for 2 months im moving to linux :D I'm downloading ubuntu as i am making this thread.
Any suggestions on what software etc i should get would help alot.
Thanks.
</3 windows xp :|

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @TeeBaggie TeeBaggie
item.description:
@TeeBaggie wrote:

^^ I’m downloading Kubuntu right now xD
its 38% done, I have no clue what to do, never used linux before.

W0000t kubuntu roxx lawl I just go tit installed xD It’s much better than I thought!

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:23, topic:80008”][quote author=kloplop321 link=topic=117498.msg1188080#msg1188080 date=1177122409]

get Kubuntu instead of ubuntu, the KDE works a lot better than the gnome thingy. Also Kubuntu because that is what mopar uses, so he can also help you, It also looks really good too!

hah lol, why would you get a distro cause one person can help you? theres an enormous community ready to fix any problem you’ve got, hurray for open sauce

well on here, and ubuntu is able to be with KDE, but it isn’t as set up as Kubuntu normally is.
[/quote]or, you can be pro and just install debian then install whatever the hell desktop you want, if you want one ;p[/quote] kubuntu has a nice logo tho

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

The basic process I see is:

wget -q http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/apt/387EE263.gpg -O- | sudo apt-key add - sudo wget http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/apt/sources.list.d/edgy.list -O /etc/apt/sources.list.d/winehq.list sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install wine

Four separate commands, all in the terminal.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @Skating_On_Java Elite2142
item.description:
@Skating_On_Java wrote:

I think so, the Konsole said I download something, I don’t know how to apply it though lol, (very used to windows).

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Well, it sounds like it wants you to create a hidden file with Kate (supposedly in your home directory) called ‘beryl-install-script’.
The method you linked to is listed as obsolete on their page. Not to mention this stuff is for “Feisty Fawn”, 7.04.

By the way, did things work out when you used the terminal to grab the file with wget?

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @Skating_On_Java Elite2142
item.description:
@Skating_On_Java wrote:

http://wiki.beryl-project.org/wiki/Install_Beryl_on_Ubuntu_Feisty_with_nVidia#Kubuntu_2 - Where do I start?

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Did you try it in the terminal? KDE calls it the “Konsole”, if I recall.

And to add, Compiz sounded more familiar to me. Beryl appears to be a fork of it, from what I read.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @Skating_On_Java Elite2142
item.description:
@Skating_On_Java wrote:

Thanks, By the way, I meant by the 3D thing is beryl.

Edit, on wine, I go to “run command” and type “sudo wget http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/apt/sources.list.d/edgy.list -O /etc/apt/sources.list.d/winehq.list” but nothing happens?

Sorry for all the questions, first day.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus'd! :O
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

How do you get the "3d" block thing to choose your desktop?

Sounds like Xgl/Compiz.

And also I cant find the download for "wine".

One of the download sections on their site lists what repository you need to add for an install to (K)Ubuntu, either 6.06 or 6.10.

Read full topic
